page.title: 10Waterly Farm, North Nibley .
page.content: Mr K.Brown of Waterly Bottom,near North Nibley owns two farms and rents one.He keeps dairy and beef cattle;he has a herd of about 70 milking Fresians and around 80 Hereford cattle including 20 suckler calves,plus a few pigs.Waterly Farm,Mr. Brown's home, is the beef unit,with the suckler calves.The pigs are kept near the house,and are fed on household refuse. Dingle Farm is the dairy unit;the 70 Fresians are milked twice a day.At Quareleaze Farm he grows grass for silage and hay.His milk is collected everyday by a milk tanker which then takes it to the Milk Marketing Board in Stonehouse,near Stroud.Most of the machinery he uses is for cultivating or haymaking,and he has 3 Ford tractors.Mr& Mrs Brown work the farms with 2 fulltime employees as is common in this area.
